question: Which of the following statements are true about [NiCl4]2-?
(a) The complex has tetrahedral geometry
(b) Co-ordination number of Ni is 2 and oxidation state is +4
(c) The complex is sp3 hybridised
(d) It is a high spin complex
(e) The complex is paramagnetic
explanation: [NiCl4]2- contains Ni2+ (3d8). Cl- is a weak field ligand, so no pairing occurs.
It forms an sp3 hybridised, tetrahedral, high spin, paramagnetic complex. Statement (b) is incorrect (CN is 4, OS is +2) [cite: 602-624].
